CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice with call for competition
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C01

TI_TEXT.P: Servicii de învăţământ şi formare profesională

SHORT_DESCR.P: Cheshire East Lifelong Learning (CELL) is commissioning an approved supplier list for Adult Education Budget Provision (entry level — level 2). Learning will be targeted at meeting local well-being and employment priorities. CELL is funded as lead body for Adult Education Budget provision and will sub-contract work under this funding stream. Providers must meet the eligibility criteria to be appointed to the list, which can be used by Cheshire East Council & its wholly/partly owned companies for 12 months. The list will be opened via The Chest 3 times (min) to appoint new providers to the list, although this is no guarantee of any volume of work. Unsuccessful providers may re-apply 3 times (max). Call-offs occur outside of The Chest as per criteria. CELL reserves the right to negotiate on bids post acceptance onto the list. The budget is £495 000 across all lots. Providers must complete & submit responses via the Chest — ref DN125012. Submission times will vary.

TITLE.P: Adult Education Budget Provision: Accredited Learning

SHORT_DESCR.P: CE LL will retain 20 % of the published funding rate of the learning aim for contract management and support as outlined below under ‘CE LL Contract Management and Support’.

For Lot 1, applicants must demonstrate knowledge of the local area, needs of the local business communities, employers and learners and be able to evidence how this knowledge has informed the programme of accredited learning aims and delivery format.

There should be a very clear focus on target groups of learners who meet the eligibility criteria (Lot 1) and would benefit most from raising their skills and applicants must be able to demonstrate their in-depth knowledge of the needs of local people and explain how they will market and recruit learners onto their programmes.

INFO_ADD.P: Scheduled date for start of award procedures: 1.8.2017

Open for use by Cheshire East Council and all wholly/partly owned companies including Tatton Park Enterprises Ltd, East Cheshire Engine of the North, Ansa Environmental Services Ltd, Civicance Ltd, Everybody Sports & Recreational Trust Ltd, Transport Service Solutions Ltd & The Skills & Growth Company.

TITLE.P: Adult Education Budget Provision: Health and Well-being Programmes (Non-accredited learning)

SHORT_DESCR.P: Health and well-being Programmes use learning as a means of improving the health and well-being of individuals. There is no requirement to progress learners onto employment, although the progression on to further learning and/or employment, if appropriate, would be a desired outcome. A positive impact on the health and well-being of learners should be demonstrated by the end of the course.

INFO_ADD.P: Scheduled date for start of award procedures: 1.8.2017

Open for use by Cheshire East Council and all wholly/partly owned companies including Tatton Park Enterprises Ltd, East Cheshire Engine of the North, Ansa Environmental Services Ltd, Civicance Ltd, Everybody Sports & Recreational Trust Ltd, Transport Service Solutions Ltd & The Skills and Growth Company.

TITLE.P: Adult Education Budget Provision: Taster/Engagement Programmes (Non-accredited learning)

SHORT_DESCR.P: Taster/engagement programmes use creative and innovative approaches to engaging individuals who may normally experience barriers to learning. The desired outcome is that learners will progress on to further learning that will lead to further learning and/or employment outcomes.

INFO_ADD.P: Scheduled date for start of award procedures: 1.8.2017

Open for use by Cheshire East Council and all wholly/partly owned companies including Tatton Park Enterprises Ltd, East Cheshire Engine of the North, Ansa Environmental Services Ltd, Civicance Ltd, Everybody Sports & Recreational Trust Ltd, Transport Service Solutions Ltd & The Skills and Growth Company.

TITLE.P: Longer programmes leading to Employment Outcomes (Non-accredited learning)

SHORT_DESCR.P: Longer programmes leading to employment outcomes are intended to equip individuals with the skills and confidence needed to be able to access work or accredited learning. The desired outcome is that learners will progress on to employment or accredited learning that will lead to employment. These programmes must be focused on the unemployed, aligned to the Skills Funding Agency funding requirements, the priorities set by CE LL and the needs of local people, communities and, where appropriate, local employers.

INFO_ADD.P: Scheduled date for start of award procedures: 1.8.2017

Open for use by Cheshire East Council and all wholly/partly owned companies including Tatton Park Enterprises Ltd, East Cheshire Engine of the North, Ansa Environmental Services Ltd, Civicance Ltd, Everybody Sports & Recreational Trust Ltd, Transport Service Solutions Ltd & The Skills & Growth Company.

TITLE.P: Additional lots may be added throughout the life of the approved supplier list.

SHORT_DESCR.P: (To be advised at a later date should the need arise).

FRAMEWORK.JUSTIFICATION: N/a — this is an open competition and will not last for more than 12 months.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Cheshire East Borough Council will incorporate a standstill period at the point information on the award of the contract is communicated to tenderers. That notification will provide full information on the award decision. The standstill period, which will be for a minimum of 10 calendar days, provides time for unsuccessful tenderers to challenge the award decision before the contract is entered into. The Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (SI No 102) provides for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by a breach of the rules to take action in the High Court (England, Wales and Northern Ireland).
